embeds.title: Glass Knife
embeds.description:
Rare Attack / 1 :green_energy: / The Silent / Slay the Spire

Deal 8 (12) damage twice. Decrease the damage of this card by 2 this combat.

messages.content: same card
glass knife-core card 2 lets go

I get why champ has rares like this, they certainly feel fitting as these big devastating signature attacks, but they just don't make any sense from a gameplay perspective. You have tons of good vigor payoffs and "champ number" frontloaded damage cards at common, heck you even start with one in your main deck (execute). Unless you find rares like this very early in the run, at a point where you still would need to add efficient frontloaded damage cards to your deck, they just don't offer you anything particularly unique or interesting. They also directly hurt your ability to pivot off of champs early game vigor dominance, and into something that can deal more sustained scaling damage in the lategame. They are nearly always going to be very disappointing to see, especially from building up rare chance and at boss rewards. Champ realistically just never has to worry about their ability to frontload damage in the early game, they can cruise through act 1 and 2 on the strength of their commons, and so scaling is by far the most important thing to add to your deck to have a plan for late game. Rares have a significant opportunity cost because of how sparse they are, so seeing ones like this feels pretty bad.

As for the actual card itself, it's fine? It does 1 more damage than skewer, and has the finisher mechanic, which is not always a good thing if you don't have several ways to re-enter stances (and since this uses up all your energy as an X card, you can't use stance entering cards that cost energy after using this). It certainly uses vigor well, but that's not remotely unique among champ cards. If this was the best card you saw from choose 1 of 3 rare cards as your starting heart bonus, it would perform well in act 1, but probably not that much better than some of your stronger commons/uncommons. It lacks flexibility as well if you're using it as a vigor payoff, since you can't play anything else after it unless it costs 0.
This is probably the rare which I'm least happy to see, yeah.
I honestly wouldn't take this floor zero. You need to spend three energy for it to pass execute's vigor use.
Honestly, looking at every other rare, I would take this over... gladiator form? Ultimate stance?
Enchant sword and shield suck, but they have decent upgrades.
I liked this card better when it had a berserker / defensive combo thing going on.
That way it was at least funny with ultimate stance.
Now it's just boring.

The upgrade is pretty good, since it gives +3 per mana spent, but you usually want your upgrades to be more utility focused once you're out of act 1 on champ. As a chem X card, it has merit to always hit for at least 16 (22), and you can cast it more fluidly, but the interaction is not strong enough to make me want to take either first (though Chem X is very solid with reinforced body on champ to have a strong frontloaded block card). You can use this a 0 cost finisher if you're really good at entering stances, but moment of truth is a far better option that provides better utility if that's what you want. I just don't think this card has a good place in champs kit, and I really wish they had a few more rares focused on late game scaling, and less focused on frontloaded damage. Maybe some of the big signature attack rares could be more focused on dealing scaling rather than frontloaded damage?
thought about it for a while.

Basic Attack / 2 :energy_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

Deal 6 (9) damage 2 times.
:finisher:   **Finisher**

messages.content: only 4 more damage than execute, a basic.

honestly I think ignore pain is good enough to be run winning. You can just win off having an apparition+ to save you in act 4. Sword throw not being ranked as bad also surprises me, I think most of the other red cards are better then it (including steel edge).

the term "run winning" to me represents a card/relic that is THE lynchpin to your deck and most of your game plan revolves around, whether it be extremely strong frontload like <gem cannon> or a late game scaling option like <exotic form>. Ignore pain is good, but it's not going to make a bad deck good and to me is not run winning.

embeds.title: Gem Cannon
embeds.description:
Rare Attack / 2 (1) :energy_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

**Exhaust** ALL Gems, including Socketed ones. Deal 10 damage to a random enemy for each. **Exhaust**.

embeds.title: Exotic Form
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 3 :energy_snek: / The Snecko / Downfall

​~~- **Snekproof.** -~~
Whenever you play an **Offclass** card, draw 1 card.

messages.content: Still an extremely strong card.
ignore pain is capable of turning a losing deck into a winning one though, having a get out of jail free card is just so strong.
It gives you more opportunities to stay alive and have a game winning run, it isn't what wins games.

In the same way I wouldn't consider <lizard tail> a game winning relic even if the extra health can win you a game (it proccing on heart/neow, or proccing before allowing you to survive and beat heart/neow)

embeds.title: Lizard Tail
embeds.description:
Rare Relic / All / Slay the Spire

When you would die, heal to 50% of your Max HP instead (works once).
*-# A fake tail to trick enemies during combat.*

messages.content: I think it's a little bit semantic-y and people have different interpretations, as the term is somewhat vague.
But to me, ignore pain is a really strong card, that may win you the run, but I wouldn't consider it run winning, you still need damage and you still need block, you still need scaling.

I would personally say there is only like 3-4 run winning cards in downfall. Gem cannon, as it is such strong frontload that it can realistically clear act 3 enemies up to the boss, allowing you to focus purely on scaling, Exotic form as it covers damage, block, scaling, everything. Infinite draw is infinite draw. It works in fat decks for just playing 20 cards in a turn all at 0 cost because muddle, and it works for crafting infinites. Next is Virus, see gem cannon. Frontloaded damage so good it can replace multiple other frontload damage cards allowing you to immediately focus on scaling (or getting strength, as it is a massive multihit (so is gem cannon idk why I didn't mention that there)) and last one is summon orb. In late game this is 18 block/damage per turn, basically play a dash+ every turn. It also activates on playing already overpowered cards, so that helps.
I don't think there is any other cards in downfall right now where simply having it shoots your win equity up by that much.
those are my top 4 cards, and ever since the just desserts and dlf nerfs I don't think anything else is close.
and yes I would consider pre-nerf just desserts probably up there with the big 4, for 1 energy you got 8 aoe damage, 12 goop, +2 card draw, and 12 block (with triple dex modifiers), and no exhaust.

one free turn does not turn a losing deck into a winning deck. If I'm losing a run and go into the final boss with a skill potion and see ignore pain, that does not mean I just win. Meanwhile, last stand's 6 strength, or shield throw's entire existence can easily do that. sword throw is a glass knife and glass knife is definitely an addable card.
Sword throw being outclassed by commons feels like a literal crime
But it's the truth

one free turn can very easily turn a loss into a win. I've taken many bad champ decks to the finish line just from being able to line up ignore pain with 1 of neow's attacks, face tank the other and kill on turn 5 or 6. Having several ignore pains, although rather rare is the easiest way for champ to win runs too. Champ can do so much better then glass knife though. I'd take sword throw if its offered super early, but its almost never been taken after the halfway point of the game. Enchant sword does far more damage then sword throw does and scales better; even gladiator form accomplishes more if you can spare the energy to play it in a boss fight.

I'd say steel edge is better then sword throw, even if only slightly. Steel edge is a win con card that suffers from being on a character that has a dozen win con attacks. Its at least functional if you try to use it though. Sword throw is an above average attack, on a character with a dozen of those too.
Sword throw can be played when your not in a stance though
The same cannot be said for this card
if you are killing on turn 5 or 6, ignore pain is not what is winning you the run LOL.
steel edge is not a win condition card either.
its really bad when your not in a stance though, if your not winning the fight on that turn getting weakened sucks.
but living for just a turn longer is what let me win?
the thing thats letting you do 200 damage a turn is?
its fair to say that it was not *just* ignore pain that won the run but it was a big contributor
also, what exactly is letting you do that high, consistent, sustained damage as champ???
ultimate stance :awaken:
nah just shield throw stuff for the most part
also having finisher spam is really good
I said shield throw is a win condition.
I never denied that shield throw is crazy, but you can have more then 1 win condition in your deck
If shield throw is the win condition then why do you need steel edge
because you don't have shield throw
ignore pain was not your win condition, it was shield throw
Their both rares
I mean on average <fan of knives> is going to do more for you in terms of dps than steel edge

embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :energy_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

messages.content: then I guess we just disagree on what a card needs to do to qualify as a win condition.
Doesn't champ also have a single target common that also hits twice?
I would also consider apparitions apart of my win condition when I take those
Than apparitions are the win condition and not the steel edge
but from my POV ignore pain is an auto take and I would only take another rare if its a scaling solution
Oh I get what blue guy means now
you don't click ignore pain and think "wow I've just solved the entire run I just need to add stuff to support this"
ignore pain IS the support
Like things that will help you kill bosses and things that actually scale throughout the course of your run
Like shield throw getting better the more your able to block for instance
And it's upgrade making the card free aswell
Things that sword throw wishes it could do
Champ needs to dedicate a lot of cards to be able to block consistently though, ignore pain lets you play far less which frees up your budget letting you win with less.
"Dedicate lots of cards"(the defensive stance in the corner)
Ignore pain requires card draw or pyramid
I do think that i've solved the entire run when I get shield throw, but I don't think that any other individual card is strong enough to the point where I can say that about them.
Both of which champ doesn't do super well
Strike of genius is really op because the generated card exhausts so it's additional stuff every turn

champ + pyramid is a free win tbh. Plus you don't really need to have active draw for most of the game, ignore pain is almost never a dead draw. You only really need draw to make sure you get it on 1 out of 2 turns on neow (or for 2 out of 3 turns vs ironclad).
its also 2 energy upfront for a benefit you gain next turn. A strong benefit but you could also just nuke the elite your fighting.
It's for bosses mainly and it's also highly unlikely your killing an act 3 elite on turn 1
Although I will say ignore pain and strike of genius pair very well together since ignore pain can help you play strike of genius without risk
This is provided you draw both at once however and that ignore pain is upgraded

You don't have to always win on turn 1, its more so that you need to get at least 2 strikes from strike of genius to break even and the fight could very easily be over before then. Ignore pain is good in every fight in the game, especially vs stuff like chosen and snecko which can be harder then elites to deal with in a typical champ deck.

snecko eye may be a great relic on champ, but getting confusion forced on you is really dangerous when you are relying on your 0 cost cards like stance dance and wind up. book of stabbing is acutally just an easier fight a lot of the time. Slavers is still harder and gremlin leader is about the same.
of course strike of genius is a really great card despite being a little bit slow. It's just not a flawless card; but very few cards are!
